Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a secure TCP chat server using Netty framework, supporting SSL/TLS encryption for secure communication between clients and the server.

Class Description: SecureChatServer is a Netty-based TCP server that handles secure chat communications. It initializes SSL context, configures server bootstrap with event loop groups, and manages server lifecycle including graceful shutdown.

Attributes:
PORT: int - The port number on which the server listens for incoming connections (default: 8992)
sslCtx: SslContext - The SSL context used for secure communication
bossGroup: EventLoopGroup - The parent event loop group that accepts incoming connections
workerGroup: EventLoopGroup - The child event loop group that handles the traffic of accepted connections

Methods:
main: main(String[] args) -> void - Entry point that initializes SSL context, configures server, binds to port, and manages server lifecycle
    - args: String[] - Command line arguments (unused in this implementation)
    - No explicit return value (void)
